Clip.Title: PHIL COLLINS: GOING BACK TO DETROIT
Clip.Episode: Phil Collins: Going Back to Detroit
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow Phil Collins back to the birthplace of Motown, as he joins the Funk Brothers for one soul-filled night of legendary music.

Clip.Title: PLAY ON JOHN: A LIFE IN MUSIC
Clip.Episode: Play on John: A Life in Music
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Before Bob Dylan and The Band there was John Chohen: the man who saved and celebrated American Folk music.

Clip.Title: THE ACCORDION KINGS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Every 10 years, Columbia's top accordion virtuosi gather to compete in a fierce musical battle to decide the undisputed Accordion King.

Clip.EpisodeSummary: Follow Phil Collins back to the birthplace of Motown, as he joins the Funk Brothers for one soul-filled night of legendary music.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey of world famous Cape Breton Island reveals why this has been called the "world's greatest road trip" - from the Canso Causeway to the Cape Breton Highlands - the island is a world unto its own.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: British Columbia's Coastal Adventures truly begin where the road ends - north of Powell River - as we explore offshore islands, inland volcanoes, and forgotten World War II defense fortifications.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of Nova Scotia is a living historical record of the centuries-old battle between the French and the English in the New World, along one of the Atlantic's most remote, hostile coastlines.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.Episode: Nepal: Cracks at the Roof of the World
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Solukhumbu contains most of the 3300 glaciers and 2300 artic lakes of Nepal. Glacier recession, which have given birth to new lakes where there was only ice and snow. Those lakes are a danger for the population, natural bombs, ready to explode.

Clip.Title: REVERSE EXPLORATION
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Palobi and Mudeya come from a tribe of Papua New Guinea. They launch on an expedition in the heart of a very strange civilization: 21st Century France.

Clip.Title: GAME OVER
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Meet a designer, a gold farmer, specialists and players who will immerse you into a virtual world that has not only influenced mass entertainment, but has become a technological, social, cultural and economic phenomenon.

Clip.Title: DECADENCE: DECLINE OF THE WESTERN WORLD
Clip.Episode: Decadence: Decline of the Western World
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This is a critique of life in the Western world today and the vaules we may now take for granted. Throughout history all civilizations rise and fall, is the West next?

Clip.Title: ELEPHANTS IN THE ROOM
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The largest creature that walks this planet is shrouded in mystery. It is the elephant; majestic, intelligent, dangerous. They can be man's best friend ... or his worst enemy. This is the story of an elephant called Wonky Tusk. She is the matriarch to her five family members. One of her impressive tusks point backwards and this makes her instantly recognisable. But she is famous for quite another reason...

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Eastern Coastline of New Brunswick is an ecological wonder- this aerial survey soars above incredible rock formations, peat farms, and some of the East Coast's most impressive sand dunes.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In this new season, fly from coast to coast along the vast and diverse terrain that lies at the border of Canada and the United States.

Clip.Title: BLONDIE'S NEW YORK
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the span of just a few years, Blondie went from a band fighting for punk cred at CBGB to international superstardom, thanks in large part to one album: Parallel Lines. What was the secret behind its success? How did it all come together...and nearly fall apart? Enter the recording studio with Blondie's frontwoman and namesake, Debbie Harry, the rest of the band, and producer Mike Chapman. Their conversations reveal the real stories behind iconic hits like "Heart of Glass" and "One Way or Another" and how they launched punk music into the mainstream.
